intro: Alfaroa guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste alfaroa, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Alfaroa guanacastensis is often found in dry forests and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
